material.mattext: Well done. You have passed this test.
Sorry, You have failed this test.
The QTI specification supports the exchange of which data structures ?
No. The correct answers are Item and Assessment.
Time-based responses are supported by the QTI specification.
Sorry, you are wrong. Time-based reponses ARE supported by the specification.
Items defined according to QTI V1.0 are not compatible with Items from QTI V1.2.
Sorry, you are wrong. V1.0 Items ARE compatible with the V1.2 specification.
The QTI specification is used within the ADL SCORM.
Sorry, you are wrong. The QTI specification is NOT used within ADL SCORM.
Which of the following statements are true about the QTI specification ?
It cannot be extended to support proprietary features
It provides different content views for different types of participants
It is based on a well established framework

respcondition.qticomment: To detect if the correct answer has been supplied.
To detect if the incorrect answer is supplied.

material.mattext: Correct answer is A, D, E.
Answers B and C are incorrect.
Multiple Assessments cannot be contained in a single QTI ASI XML instance.
Sorry, you are wrong. A QTI-XML instance CAN contain multiple Asssessments.
Which one of the following data structures is used to provide hierarchically structured assessments ?
No. Only Sections support hierachical Assessments.
Which versions of the QTI specifications support results reporting ?
Yes. Only V1.2 supports results reporting.
No. Only V1.2 supports results reporting.
Which question types are supported by the full QTI specification ?
Correct. All of those question types are supported.
No. All of those question types are supported.
Which question types are supported by the QTILite specification ?
No. Only True/False and Multiple-choice are supported.
The QTI specification supports the exchange of which data structures ?
No. The correct answers are Item and Assessment.
Time-based responses are supported by the QTI specification.
Sorry, you are wrong. Time-based reponses ARE supported by the specification.
Items defined according to QTI V1.0 are not compatible with Items from QTI V1.2.
Sorry, you are wrong. V1.0 Items ARE compatible with the V1.2 specification.
The QTI specification is used within the ADL SCORM.
Sorry, you are wrong. The QTI specification is NOT used within ADL SCORM.
Which of the following statements are true about the QTI specification ?
It cannot be extended to support proprietary features
It provides different content views for different types of participants
It is based on a well established framework
